scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to prioritize your time off and asked your colleague to reach out to another person. Later, you meet with [Monica] and [Bob] at a team gathering. [Monica] glances at you with a concerned expression, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you didn't help with the urgent task while you were on leave. [Bob] had to stay late to cover for you. What happened?' You responded by saying it was fair to ask someone else to handle it since you were on leave. The conversation continues. [Bob] sighs and says, 'I understand you're on leave, but couldn't you have at least checked in to see if it was really urgent? It put a lot of pressure on us.' You suggested brainstorming ways to handle such situations better in the future. The conversation shifts slightly as [Monica] looks thoughtful.
scenes.description: [Monica] raises an eyebrow, 'So, how do you propose we handle these urgent tasks in the future without burdening anyone unfairly?'

options.text: We could set up a rotating on-call system for emergencies. That way, no one person is always on the hook.
options.analysis: You offer a practical solution, showing good emotional perception and social skills while maintaining balance.

options.text: Maybe we need to hire a part-time person for these specific situations. It could save us all some stress.
options.analysis: You suggest an external solution, showing empathy and a reasonable approach but slightly lesser self-regulation.

options.text: Honestly, I think everyone just needs to be more prepared. We can't always rely on others to cover for us.
options.analysis: You emphasize personal responsibility, showing strong self-regulation but less empathy and social skills.
